ai-tha-ap337:1.2_0: for the sake of the world’s enjoying the benefit of the world.
ai-tha-ap337:2.1_0: “Having gone forth in the monastery, they have no sense of urgency,
ai-tha-ap337:2.3_0: with a hundred thousand people making a thousand sacrifices
ai-tha-ap337:2.4_0: The eighth destroyed by the pollutants.
ai-tha-ap337:3.3_0: The Kuvera’s mother is the best,
ai-tha-ap337:4.2_0: At the time I was born:
ai-tha-ap337:4.3_0: The Kuvera’s mother is the best,
ai-tha-ap337:4.4_0: the Buddha is very best of men,
ai-tha-ap337:5.1_0: Having been understood by the Sambuddha, the Awakened One
ai-tha-ap337:5.2_0: Wealth is the best of towns,
ai-tha-ap337:5.3_0: Having done a deed, having given up my work,
ai-tha-ap337:6.2_0: For those who worship that victor,
ai-tha-ap337:6.4_0: acting as ruler of the gods.
ai-tha-ap337:8.1_0: When the King, I let the chariot-maker
ai-tha-ap337:8.2_0: When the fools come to a net,
ai-tha-ap337:8.4_0: I am affected by old age,
ai-tha-ap337:10.3_0: With the utter ending of all defilements,
ai-tha-ap337:11.3_0: my body is dead and fragrance;
ai-tha-ap337:12.1_0: like a god pond with a sword,
ai-tha-ap337:12.2_0: the Community of monks have done good deeds.
ai-tha-ap337:13.2_0: and even all kinds of grass—
ai-tha-ap337:13.4_0: though the odorned with scented fragrance,
ai-tha-ap337:14.2_0: I woke off the dust of the gods.
ai-tha-ap337:14.3_0: I’m not aware of any living being
ai-tha-ap337:16.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Phussa.
